[SYNTAX]: Minor awkward phrasing (e.g., "the things that I remember arise, and hover" in poetic excerpt, but mostly in prose sections).

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shifts between historical events (e.g., Red Feather to De Soto; DeLeon’s efforts to Angelina’s naming).
[CLARITY]: Assumes prior knowledge of figures (e.g., De Soto, LaSalle) without introduction.

[SYNTAX]: Occasionally overly complex sentence structures (e.g., "Gil Ybarbo... was officially known as...")

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shift from Ybarbo’s removal to "Nacogdoches was at that time the second largest town in Texas"
[STRUCTURE]: Tangential mention of Louisiana Purchase at the end without clear connection to preceding narrative
